column4: Does anyone here know how to use brctl?  I've been trying to figure it out for over an hour to no prevail
cchancl:  if you set your fstab to mount your ntfs partition, you can browse to it like any other folder
do u happen to know anything about nvidia driver installation

im trying to install my nvidia xgl from the synaptic package manager, i follow the steps, and everything, but when i restart i get an error saying that i dont have the right kernel or something, my current kernel is 2.6.17-10-386 can someone help me set it up, anyone? im kinda stuck here
- ahh i had that problem, see... ubutnu provides nvidia-glx-common.  So you have to remove that... but when you remove that it will try to remove linux-restricted-whatnot which contains drivers
- try this:  sudo gedit /etc/default/linux-restricted-modules-common and in the disabled modules disable nvidia
does that install the dirvers? i want to install the nvidia glx drivers,
no actually i used synaptic package Manager
it didnt work. so i had to do it this way, is there a way to restore the old kernel and have the spm do it for me? through GUI?
ill try that, thanks alot bro
